techniques.name: Phishing
techniques.description: Adversaries may send phishing messages to gain access to victim systems. Phishing is when an attacker attempts to trick a user into submitting private data, clicking a malicious link, or opening a malicious attachment.
detection: Monitor for suspicious email attachments
Look for links to newly registered domains
Check email headers for spoofing indicators
Alert on macro-enabled document execution
mitigations: Disable macros by default in Office
techniques.real_world: SolarWinds supply chain attack began with spear-phishing targeting IT administrators

techniques.name: Data Encrypted for Impact
techniques.description: Adversaries may encrypt data on target systems to interrupt availability. They may attempt to render stored data inaccessible by encrypting files or data and then extorting the victim for a decryption key.
detection: Monitor for rapid file modification events
Alert on new file extensions being written at high volume
Detect VSS deletion commands
Monitor for ransom note file creation (README.txt, DECRYPT.txt)
mitigations: Restrict write permissions to critical directories
Monitor and alert on bulk file modification
techniques.real_world: WannaCry (2017) infected 200,000+ systems across 150 countries in 72 hours

techniques.name: Remote Services
techniques.description: Adversaries may use Valid Accounts to log into a service specifically designed to accept remote connections. This allows the adversary to move laterally through an environment using legitimate credentials.
detection: Alert on RDP/SMB connections between workstations
Monitor for unusual service account usage
Detect logons outside business hours from service accounts
Alert on new RDP sessions from non-admin accounts
mitigations: Network segmentation to restrict lateral movement
Privileged Access Workstations for admin tasks
Disable RDP on workstations unless required
techniques.real_world: NotPetya spread via EternalBlue SMB exploit, causing $10B in damages globally

techniques.name: Brute Force
techniques.description: Adversaries may use brute force techniques to gain access to accounts when passwords are unknown. Brute force techniques include: password guessing, password spraying, and credential stuffing.
detection: Alert on 10+ failed logons in 60 seconds from one source
Monitor for distributed logon failures across multiple accounts
Detect logon attempts from TOR exit nodes
Alert on successful logon following multiple failures
mitigations: Account lockout policy (10 failures = 30 min lockout)
techniques.real_world: 2021 Colonial Pipeline attack preceded by VPN credential compromise via dark web

techniques.name: Exfiltration Over C2 Channel
techniques.description: Adversaries may steal data by exfiltrating it over an existing command and control channel. Stolen data is encoded into the normal communications channel using the same protocol as the C2.
detection: Alert on large outbound data transfers > 500MB
Monitor for long-duration low-bandwidth connections to rare IPs
Detect DNS queries with unusually long subdomains (DNS tunnelling)
Alert on HTTPS traffic to newly registered domains
mitigations: Data Loss Prevention (DLP) on all egress points
Network traffic analysis for anomaly detection
Egress filtering to allowed destination list
UEBA to detect unusual data access patterns
techniques.real_world: APT41 used encrypted C2 channels to exfiltrate 1TB+ from healthcare organisations

techniques.name: Valid Accounts
techniques.description: Adversaries may obtain and abuse credentials of existing accounts as a means of gaining initial access or persistence. Compromised credentials may be used to bypass access controls.
detection: Alert on logons from impossible travel (same account, different countries within 1 hour)
Monitor for service accounts logging on interactively
Detect account usage outside normal hours
Alert on accounts logging in from Tor/VPN services
mitigations: Regular account audits and access reviews
techniques.real_world: Uber breach (2022) via social engineering to steal contractor VPN credentials

techniques.name: Exfiltration Over Web Service
techniques.description: Adversaries may use an existing, legitimate external Web service to exfiltrate data rather than their primary command and control channel. Popular Web services acting as an exfiltration channel may give a significant amount of cover due to the likelihood of blending into normal traffic.
detection: Monitor for unusual uploads to cloud storage (Dropbox, OneDrive, Google Drive)
Alert on access to unapproved cloud services
Detect large file uploads via proxy logs
Alert on OAuth token grants to unknown applications
mitigations: Block access to non-approved cloud storage
Monitor and alert on bulk data transfers
techniques.real_world: Insider at Tesla stole 26,000 files by uploading to personal cloud storage

techniques.name: Exploit Public-Facing Application
techniques.description: Adversaries may attempt to take advantage of a weakness in an Internet-facing computer or program using software, data, or commands in order to cause unintended or unanticipated behavior.
detection: Monitor web application firewall logs for injection patterns
Alert on error rate spikes from public-facing applications
Detect unusual process execution from web server processes
Monitor for new administrative accounts created by web services
techniques.real_world: Log4Shell (CVE-2021-44228) allowed RCE on millions of systems via a log message
